Title: Downsites of Offline First · RxDB
Description:
So you have read all theses things about how the offline first paradigm makes it easy to create realtime web applications that even work when the user has no internet connection.
But there is no free lunch. The offline first paradigm is not the perfect approach for all kinds of apps.

Title: Fast, Parallel Database Tests | Kevin Burke
Description:
Here are some of the different strategies you can use to write tests that read
or write data from a database, and the benefits and drawbacks of each. I'm
usually writing Go code, so the examples here are for Go, but the notes should
generalize to any language that runs tests against Postgres, MySQL, or any other
database.

Title: Copycats and Endurance - The Bootstrapped Founder
Description: Reading Time: 3 minutes Almost every product that ranks #1 on ProductHunt eventually gets copied. Someone sees an interesting product getting traction and decides to build the same thing. They check out the product’s landing page, copy that verbatim, and sign up for a free account. Title: How to manage Personal Access Tokens with Azure DevOps panel
Description: Managing personal access tokens (PATs) can be difficult and time-consuming because they are long strings of characters that are hard to memorize or keep track of. Azure DevOps has made this process much easier with their Personal Access Token Management panel. This tutorial will go through the process of how to find and manage PATs in the Azure DevOps Management app.
